Photos.Model

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Photos.Model.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Database that stores information about the users in the application. Handles all requests from the application, including searches, adds, and deletes. Serializes and deserializes the data as needed.
    Author:
    Krysti Leong, April Dizon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean addUser(User user)
        Add a User to the database as long as it does not already exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - User to add.
        Returns:
        True if it was added, false if it already existed and was not added.

      • deleteUser

        public DBStatus deleteUser(User user)
        Delete a User from the database as long as it's not the admin User.
        Parameters:
        user - User to delete.
        Returns:
        True if it was deleted, false if it was the admin user and was not deleted.

      • authorize

        public boolean authorize(java.lang.String username,

        Authorize the user by checking if this user's username and password is in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the user.
        password - Password of the user.
        Returns:
        True if their username and password is in the database, false elsewise.

      • searchByTag

        public java.util.List<Photo> searchByTag(User user,
                                         Tag tag)
        Search a user's photos by their tags.
        Parameters:
        user - User that has the photos to be searched.
        tag - Tag to find.
        Returns:
        List of photos found that has the tag.

      • searchByTagConjunctive

        public java.util.List<Photo> searchByTagConjunctive(User user,
                                                    Tag tag1,
                                                    Tag tag2)
        Find photos that have the given 2 tags. Done by taking the intersection of photos that have the first tag, and photos that have the second tag.
        Parameters:
        user - User that has the photos to be searched.
        tag1 - First tag.
        tag2 - Second tag.
        Returns:
        List of photos that have both tags.

      • searchByTagDisjunctive

        public java.util.List<Photo> searchByTagDisjunctive(User user,
                                                    Tag tag1,
                                                    Tag tag2)
        Find photos that have the either the 2 tags. Done by taking the union of photos that have the first tag, and photos that have the second tag.
        Parameters:
        user - User that has the photos to be searched.
        tag1 - First tag.
        tag2 - Second tag.
        Returns:
        List of photos that have either tags.

      • searchByDate

        public java.util.List<Photo> searchByDate(User user,
                                          java.util.Calendar start,
                                          java.util.Calendar finish)
        Search for photos by date range.
        Parameters:
        user - User that has the photos.
        start - Starting date.
        finish - Ending date.
        Returns:
        List of photos found, if any, or null.
